TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed InteractivityPostBackMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the postback modes of the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ReportViewer"> control when the user interacts with the report viewer and the currently displayed report.
Docs.remarks:
<!CDATA[
## Remarks This enumeration is referenced by the <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ReportViewer.InteractivityPostBackMode%2A> property in <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ReportViewer>.
If you want the **ReportViewer** control to perform URL redirection on drillthrough actions, use F:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.InteractivityPostBackMode.SynchronousOnDrillthrough?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. URL redirection is not a supported response to asynchronous postbacks. For more information on synchronous and asynchronous postbacks, see [Partial-Page Rendering Overview](../Topic/Partial-Page%20Rendering%20Overview.md).
]>

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.InteractivityPostBackMode AlwaysAsynchronous = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.InteractivityPostBackMode AlwaysSynchronous = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.InteractivityPostBackMode SynchronousOnDrillthrough = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Perform synchronous postbacks on drillthrough actions, and asynchronous postbacks on other actions. In this mode, both clicking a drillthrough report and clicking the **Back to Parent** button will cause synchronous postbacks. For more information on drillthrough reports, see [Adding Drillthrough Reports](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d57866f5-d876-41ce-bc49-0e72486a9617) in SQL Server Books Online.
